description.value: The brain makes up to five attacks with its tendrils. No more than two of these attacks can be made against any one target per turn.
The brain makes up to five attacks with its tendrils. No more than two of these attacks can be made against any one target per turn.
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 25 ft., one humanoid creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). The brain has two mind tendrils, each of which can grapple only one target. If the brain uses this action on a creature it is already grappling, that creature must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by the brain, ignoring any immunity to the charmed condition the target may possess.

    A creature charmed by this action is no longer grappled by the brain, though the tendril remains wrapped around its neck, preventing the creature from moving further than 25 ft. from the brain. The target is compelled to obey the brain's telepathic commands, transmitted to the target via the tendril. The target must carry out these commands to the best of its ability.

    A charmed creature can repeat its save at the start of each of its turns if it has taken damage or been forced to attack one of its allies since the start of its previous turn. On a successful save, the condition ends and the target frees itself from the tendril's grip. The tendril can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 1; immune to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), ending the charmed condition immediately.

description.value: The brain makes a mind lash attack if its shell is open.

description.value: The brain makes a mind lash attack if its shell is open.

data.chatFlavor: DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by the brain, ignoring any immunity to the charmed condition the target may possess.

description.value: (Costs 2 Actions). The brain forces a powerful outward surge of water, filling a 30-foot cube projected out from itself. Each other creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or take 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 10 ft. away from the brain. A creature that is swimming fails its save automatically. A creature with a swim speed takes no damage if it fails its save.

data.chatFlavor: Fail and be pushed 10 ft. away from the brain. A creature that is swimming fails its save automatically. A creature with a swim speed takes no damage if it fails its save.

description.value:
The brain can take 3 legendary actions. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The brain regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

The brain can take 3 legendary actions.

The brain can take 3 legendary actions. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The brain regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

The brain can take 3 legendary actions.
The brain makes a tendril attack.
The brain makes a tendril attack.
The brain's AC can't be less than 8 plus its Wisdom bonus.
The brain's AC can't be less than 8 plus its Wisdom bonus.
The brain can't benefit from increases to speed, and can't be moved by force, including by teleportation.
The brain can't benefit from increases to speed, and can't be moved by force, including by teleportation.
When the brain is forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, it makes a Constitution saving throw and uses that result instead.
